On Mar 27, 2007, at 11:36 PM, Jason Gauci wrote:

> In conjunction with the paper I will also be releasing my source  
> code under the GPL  (or some similar) license within the next  
> couple of weeks.  The code is written in C++, is modular (NEAT is a  
> separate library for anyone wanting straight NEAT code), and uses   
> CMake, which means you can use whatever programming IDE you want to  
> edit and build the source.  Also, because I needed to demostrate  
> individuals with millions of links in real time, the neural network  
> code is pretty highly optimized.

Hi Jason,

Congrats on the paper, it's good.

I'm *very* much looking forward to your code.

That you can update ~90M neurons/second is impressive.

--Steve
--Apple-Mail-4--808741419
